entry.title: Stieler's portrait of Beethoven (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Stieler's portrait of Beethoven (pictured), the composer's arms "are not convincingly attached to his shoulders"?

entry.title: Fumiya Takahashi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fumiya Takahashi was referred to as "the most handsome highschooler in Japan"?

entry.title: malfurada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that popular garden plants like malfurada often escape from cultivation and become invasive?

entry.title: Olivia Olson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olivia Olson won state championships as a soccer goalkeeper and a basketball guard?

entry.title: Jewish cemetery in the Dutch city of Hoorn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Jewish cemetery in the Dutch city of Hoorn was cleared in 1968 to make room for a roadway, and the bodily remains and gravestones were moved to the public cemetery?

entry.title: Nilüfer Gürsoy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nilüfer Gürsoy's memoirs detail the 1960 Turkish coup d'état, which overthrew her father?

entry.title: 1997 Spring Creek flood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the 1997 Spring Creek flood, a railroad embankment suppressing 8,250 cubic feet (234 m3) of water per second overflowed, causing a train to derail?

entry.title: 145 Piccadilly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Elizabeth II's childhood toys at 145 Piccadilly included 30 toy horses and a farm set collected from Woolworths?
